viewData.name: Dell 13.3" Inspiron 13 5000 Series Multi-Touch 2-in-1 Notebook
viewData.short_description: Buy Dell 13.3" Inspiron 13 5000 Series Multi-Touch 2-in-1 Notebook featuring 2.4 GHz Intel Core i3-7100U Dual-Core, 4GB DDR4 | 1TB HDD 13.3" 1920 x 1080 IPS Touchscreen. Review Dell 13 5000
viewData.long_description: With its 360Â° hinge design, the 13.3" Inspiron 13 5000 Series Multi-Touch 2-in-1 Notebook from Dell allows you to switch between four different modes. You can use Tent Mode for using recipes in real time, Stand Mode for movies on an airplane, Laptop Mode for typing your novel or emailing work, and Tablet Mode to make reading easier while you're reclined. The Inspiron 13 5000 measures just 0.77" thin and weighs 3.7 pounds. The 13.3" TrueLife IPS widescreen display features a Full HD 1920 x 1080 resolution. With its 16:9 aspect ratio, 1080p HD content is displayed without scaling or letterboxing. The display also features touch support, so you'll be able to utilize the multi-touch gestures incorporated into Windows 10. You can swipe, tap, and resize apps at your preference. The system is powered by a 2.4 GHz Intel Core i3-7100U Dual-Core processor. It also has 4GB of 2400 MHz DDR4 RAM, a 1TB SATA hard drive, two USB 3.1 Gen 1 Type-A ports (one with PowerShare), one USB 2.0 port Type-A port, one HDMI port, a built-in SD/SDHC/SDXC card reader, dual-band Wi-Fi 5 (802.11ac), , an integrated 720p webcam, dual integrated microphones, and stereo speakers that are driven by the Realtek ALC3253 codec with Waves MaxxAudio Pro. Included with this system are a 45W AC adapter that operates using 100-240 VAC at 50-60 Hz and a 3-cell / 42Wh battery that can recharge in around four hours. Windows 10 Home (64-bit) is the installed operating system. Windows 10 Home improves the user experience of Windows with several additions and changes. Cortana, Microsoft's digital assistant, is integrated into Windows 10 and is available to answer questions with information gathered from both your system and the internet. Microsoft Edge replaces Internet Explorer, and the Windows Store is now unified to include apps for PCs, tablets, and phones, which can now take advantage of the Windows Continuum feature. Xbox One streaming and integration for supported games are also included.
